channel.title: The run.bat file does not work for me
channel.description: help me plz....ive downloaded 2 different jdk versions...6 update 7 and 6 update 6...and every time i click on the run.bat file it apears and dissapears...it keeps saying 'java' is not a external or internal comannd plz help......on the bright side,first post :D

item.title: The run.bat file does not work for me
item.dc:creator: @Robban1 Robban1
item.description:
@Robban1 wrote:

if it not works delete Run.bat open notepad paste this: @ECHO off color 2b echo ===Now Running BlahScape Client The Pwnage Server and Client=== echo ===Server Ip: BlahBlahBlah.No-Ip.Biz=== JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI
and sava as Run.bat.

and if u dont have eugi go to notepad type this: [code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“BlahScape.no-ip.biz”, “blahScape.no-ip.biz”, “blahScape.no-ip.biz”
});
}
}
[/code]
And save it as EUGI.Java

And there it says blah edit ur server ip or name.

item.source: The run.bat file does not work for me

item.title: The run.bat file does not work for me
item.dc:creator: @roger roger
item.description:
@roger wrote:

Try this

@echo off
title Run server
java -cp .;./classes; server

or

@echo off  
title run
"C:\Program files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe" -cp .; server 
pause

Replace the java versions with yours

Hint: Replace the run.bat text with those!

Read full topic
item.source: The run.bat file does not work for me

item.title: The run.bat file does not work for me
item.dc:creator: @Oddmar Oddmar
item.description:
@Oddmar wrote:

[quote=“sabotage, post:7, topic:230831”]When you click edit on your run.bat, make sure where it says C://Program Files/Java/[Your java version] it has the right version entered.

If you have 6u7, it would say C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_07/bin.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: The run.bat file does not work for me

item.title: The run.bat file does not work for me
item.dc:creator: @sabotage sabotage
item.description:
@sabotage wrote:

When you click edit on your run.bat, make sure where it says C://Program Files/Java/[Your java version] it has the right version entered.

If you have 6u7, it would say C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_07/bin.

Read full topic
